meanings.definition: To remove from a position of power or authority, especially from a throne.
meanings.sent1: The rebels were successful in unthroning the unjust king.
meanings.sent2: The people celebrated the unthroning of the oppressive ruler.
meanings.sent3: The unthroning of the tyrant brought relief to the kingdom.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, unthroning the opponent's king is the ultimate goal.
meanings.sent5: The fairy tale ended with the hero unthroning the evil queen.

meanings.definition: The act of dethroning or removing from power.
meanings.sent1: The unthroning of the dictator was a turning point in history.
meanings.sent2: The kingdom's stability was shaken by the sudden unthroning of the monarch.
meanings.sent3: The play depicted the unthroning of the prince in a comedic light.
meanings.sent4: The unthroning of the CEO led to chaos in the company.
meanings.sent5: The legend spoke of a prophecy foretelling the unthroning of the ruler.
